verses.text: <a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-1/" title="Song of Solomon 4:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Behold, thou *art* fair, my love; behold, thou *art* fair; thou *hast* doves' eyes within thy locks: thy hair *is* as a flock of goats, that appear from mount Gilead.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-2/" title="Song of Solomon 4:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 Thy teeth *are* like a flock *of sheep that are even* shorn, which came up from the washing; whereof every one bear twins, and none *is* barren among them.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-3/" title="Song of Solomon 4:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 Thy lips *are* like a thread of scarlet, and thy speech *is* comely: thy temples *are* like a piece of a pomegranate within thy locks.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-4/" title="Song of Solomon 4:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 Thy neck *is* like the tower of David builded for an armoury, whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, all shields of mighty men.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-5/" title="Song of Solomon 4:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Thy two breasts *are* like two young roes that are twins, which feed among the lilies.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-6/" title="Song of Solomon 4:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-7/" title="Song of Solomon 4:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Thou *art* all fair, my love; *there is* no spot in thee.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-8/" title="Song of Solomon 4:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 Come with me from Lebanon, *my* spouse, with me from Lebanon: look from the top of Amana, from the top of Shenir and Hermon, from the lions' dens, from the mountains of the leopards.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-9/" title="Song of Solomon 4:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, *my* spouse; thou hast ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, with one chain of thy neck.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-10/" title="Song of Solomon 4:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 How fair is thy love, my sister, *my* spouse! how much better is thy love than wine! and the smell of thine ointments than all spices!

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-11/" title="Song of Solomon 4:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Thy lips, O *my* spouse, drop *as* the honeycomb: honey and milk *are* under thy tongue; and the smell of thy garments *is* like the smell of Lebanon.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-12/" title="Song of Solomon 4:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 A garden inclosed *is* my sister, *my* spouse; a spring shut up, a fountain sealed.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-13/" title="Song of Solomon 4:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 Thy plants *are* an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; camphire, with spikenard,

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-14/" title="Song of Solomon 4:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 Spikenard and saffron; calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices:
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-15/" title="Song of Solomon 4:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, and streams from Lebanon.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-4-16/" title="Song of Solomon 4:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 Awake, O north wind; and come, thou south; blow upon my garden, *that* the spices thereof may flow out. Let my beloved come into his garden, and eat his pleasant fruits.
